attributes.action: Reduce the amount of plastic used in the KS2 SATs process.
attributes.background: Governors at our school were shocked when shown the amount of plastic not only used, but also thrown away during the administration of the KS2 SATs process.
attributes.additional_details: The amount of plastic used to keep the papers secure is largely unnecessary, added to which the number of bags within bags needed for the returns process is excessive, and contrary to the current public drive to reduce such waste.

attributes.action: Hold a country wide referendum on whether we should bring back the death penalty
attributes.background: Our prisons are overcrowded and under funded bringing back the death penalty for crimes such as murder,terrorism,rape and peodphillia will reduce our prison population and will also save the tax payer millions if not billions a year.

attributes.action: Require MPs to give a full explanation when they refuse to represent you.
attributes.background: MP can refuse to represent constituents and choose not to reply to any form of communication unless legally obligated eg subject access request. They do not need to give an explanation, it leaves constituents cut off from all lines of communication if they wish to ask questions of their government.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no way to challenge their decision. 

Apparently it’s an MP’s democratic right to not represent you or give an explanation which I find utterly ridiculous as they are there to hold the government accountable. 

This ability that MPs have to cut off constituents from questioning their government is wholly unacceptable. The rules should be changed so they have to give an explanation.

attributes.action: Make detentions in schools illegal if the parent's do not give consent.
attributes.background: I believe after-school detentions of students without parental consent should be banned because it is unfair to the parents if they have something planned and occasionally schools give detentions in poor judgement so I think its important to show the parent's opinion on the matter.

attributes.action: Introduce a law to fit microchips in every ammunition round produced in the UK
attributes.background: With gun crime on the rise in the UK, it makes sense to try to detect those people carrying ammunition by means of a detection device worn by anyone with a reason to do so e.g. Police officers. A gun with no ammunition cannot kill.
attributes.additional_details: This will take time, but will reap benefits in years to come once existing stocks have depleted. This would need a small hand held device that could be worn by security officials that will send a vibrating alarm to the wearer and log the GPS location and serial numbers of all ammunition read by the microchips. The microchips would be similar to those used in dogs, only the size of a grain of rice. They would be inserted, by law into the gunpowder of every round made.

attributes.action: Bring back hanging for people who kill others and rape children.
attributes.background: Many rapists go into prison and then come out to commit the same crime which is a massive issue with the system today many rape victims feel scared their rapist will try to attack them again. These people who commit these crimes shouldn't be allowed back into society.

attributes.action: Change English law such that an offer on a house is a binding contract
attributes.background: Making it a more binding contract to offer on a house would help speed up moving house and prevent people spending thousands of pounds only for their buyer to withdraw or the seller to accept to a higher bid. This is how the system works in Scotland.
attributes.additional_details: Twice this year I have accepted offers on my property and spent money in solicitors fees only for them to pull out. I think once an offer is made on a property it should be made harder in law for a person to pull out of buying that property.

attributes.action: Make it an offence to have a dog off lead on or near any public highway.
attributes.background: To protect the general public,drivers, other dog walkers and their dogs, all dogs, no matter how well behaved they may be, should be kept on a lead on or near any road.
attributes.additional_details: I have had three incidents myself recently involving loose dogs, which have been frightening for myself and my dog, but also which could have resulted in accident or injuries. In one incident a dog ran accross a busy road to get to mine, the owner said 'sorry, but he's friendly' - lucky he wasn't 'dead friendly'. I also know personally of several cases where dogs have been attacked by loose dogs, one of which was on their own driveway. Sadly the owners seem to think this is acceptable behaviour.

attributes.action: Require teachers to wear a uniform
attributes.background: Pupils have to wear uniforms for numerous reasons and if not are punished and sent home even if parents cannot afford it. I think it would be fair for teachers to have to wear them too to set examples to the students and also for security reasons to help prevent non staff members being on site.
attributes.additional_details: When not supposed to be on site, it will also help them to be identified by the pupils and parents etc. I strongly believe that figures in authority should lead by the examples they lead and follow the same rules as the pupils with uniforms and piercing and hair cuts etc police ambulance firefighters etc all wear uniforms so teachers should too.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for gambling companies to accept credit cards
attributes.background:
This petition is looking to tackle the problem of credit card use within the gambling industry.

The use of credit cards allows for a huge debt to be ran up without due diligence carried out.

There needs to be proper regulation on the source of funds used to gamble.

attributes.action: One Island-One Member of Parliament -please keep our single MP for Isle of Wight
attributes.background:
10 September 2018
Commission's "final recommendations" to divide the Island to have 2 MPs. This is divisive. We need one MP to speak for all of us. One Island - one MP!

http://www.iwcp.co.uk/news/16832323.final-recommendations-for-isle-of-wight-parliamentary-constituencies-revealed/?ref=mr&lp=4
attributes.additional_details:
If you want one MP to support all of us as a united Island with one strong voice in Parliament, please support this petition. 

Thank you very much for your kind help.

attributes.action: Ban child targeted advertising on unhealthy foods.
attributes.background: We have a huge obesity problem in the UK, yet we're targeting young children when selling unhealthy foods. Walking around the supermarket, I regularly see chocolate bars with Paw Patrol characters on the wrappers. This is shocking and needs to be stopped if we have any chance in tackling obesity.

attributes.action: Create a National Care Service
attributes.background:
This country needs a sister service to the NHS to focus on social care 

Care of vulnerable and elderly citizens 

Giving  social care a new and unique identity 

This new service would create new and specialised employment with career paths offering a rewarding career with decent pay
attributes.additional_details:
Social care has a poor image , often seen as low paid casual work 
But yet so vital in this age of an older generation 
A new identity a new structure 
With new career paths is needed

attributes.action: Government to fund a rail/bus discount card for those in education until age 18.
attributes.background: My friend's 16-year-old daughter is starting college this year and will need to travel by train and as there is no other alternative she has had to purchase an adult season ticket at huge expense.
attributes.additional_details:
As all children are expected to remain in education until the age of 18 it is unfair that their parents should have to pay full adult rail and bus fares for them.

Because our train and bus companies are all privately owned it is very difficult to ask them to change their policies, however, I do believe that the Government has a duty of care to all students and those undertaking low paid apprenticeships and I would like to ask Government to consider funding a student/young persons rail/bus discount card thereby helping to reduce travelling costs for parents.

attributes.action: Allow Industrial Hemp to be grown without a Home Office License (4 plants)
attributes.background: I propose a registered scheme with local police to allow UK adults to grow 4 plants of Industrial Hemp ONLY at home without a Home Office License. With tested seeds that are below 0.2% THC. Allowing individuals to grow safe CBD Hemp at home for personal use only . With labelled & tagged plants.
attributes.additional_details:
Iskedjian et al. Meta-analysis of cannabis based treatments for neuropathic and multiple sclerosis-related pain. Curr Med Res Opin. 23(1):17-24.(2007).
 Bergamaschi et al. Safety and side effects of cannabidiol, a Cannabis sativa constituent. Curr Drug Saf. 2011 Sep 1;6(4):237-49.

The fact there has never been a single recorded case of a death caused by CBD or even a psychotic episode caused by CBD . I am in no way endorsing Recreational Cannabis , but urging you to consider this alternative.

attributes.action: Prevent shops from selling or advertising Christmas product until advent starts.
attributes.background: Christmas is a special time of year for children, however, the magic is being diluted due to trade and commerce. It is August 2018 and already there are Christmas products on display in shops in the UK. This is absurd. Christmas advertising should be restricted by legislation to advent.
attributes.additional_details: Yesterday (14/08/18) I saw Santa toys for sale in Poundland. Other people have reported products in Tesco. This world is hard enough for todays children without depriving them of the one magical period each year to look forward to, without making them bored of Christmas songs by mid November. I accept businesses need to plan in advance for such a profitable period but the public face of Christmas should be reserved until advent.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of all acid that burns the skin on contact
attributes.background: Today I walked into a discount home store and found acid on sale for £1.99. Thousands of lives destroyed for only £1.99.
attributes.additional_details: As a plumber I have used acid before and find it is dangerous even for me to use, even when standing back from it and reaching out to pour it down the drain it can still burn my eyes and face from the fumes. As a result I do not use it for cleaning drains, acid destroys the plug hole and all seals on the pipes. There is no need for it to be used for plumbing. Acids are used in a lot of items from lemons to drain cleaner, however some are diluted and would not cause harm, so i am asking for all acids that burn the skin instantly to be banned outright.

attributes.action: Make sensory rooms compulsory in schools and provide separate funding for it.
attributes.background: CAMHS is in a serious and worsening crisis and it is failing our children.   The first step to helping our children would be to equip our schools with sensory rooms.  This will be the foundation block for children with specialist learning needs, including autism and learning disabilities
attributes.additional_details:
Sensory rooms in schools will benefit our children hugely.  Please give your full support
https://www.experia-innovations.co.uk/blog/the-benefits-of-a-sensory-room/   
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/health/nhs-mental-health-services-children-turn-away-day-vulnerable-nspcc-study-a8047401.html
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/oct/24/mental-health-children-camhs-jeremy-hunt-nhs-tragedies-funding-cuts
What is a sensory room
https://www.green-modular.com/blog/sensory-rooms-schools/

attributes.action: Impose a mandatory life sentence for acid attackers.
attributes.background: The act must be premeditated for the attcker to come prepared with acid, the effects are often lifelong and severe, the attacker knows this. Let's put the victim first in this sickening act.

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for all NHS staff
attributes.background: NHS staff are dedicated and commited to providing excellent healthcare for all people, however on the low wages they receive it seems only fair that they can take care of themselves too as a thank you.

attributes.action: Establish Compulsory Mental Health & Wellbeing Workshops for Secondary Schools
attributes.background: To date, there has been a marked increase in youth related depression and suicide. Taboos against mental health confound public acceptance of mental health issues. This petition aims to address this, starting with the introduction of compulsory mental health workshops to secondary education.
attributes.additional_details:
Sources:

https://www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/wellbeing/adhocs/006721childrensmentalillhealthbytimespentonsocialnetworkingsitesuk2013to2014

https://www.time-to-change.org.uk/blog/why-mental-illness-regarded-taboo-compared-physical-illness

https://www.theguardian.com/society/2009/feb/20/mental-health-taboo

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/education/education-news/millennials-uk-mental-health-depression-world-ranking-second-worst-study-anxiety-a7572026.html

attributes.action: Use the money paid at hospital parkings for the NHS
attributes.background: Hospital parking is so expensive but the public would not begrudge paying it if they knew it would benefit the NHS

attributes.action: Remove the 'minimum ban' on drink drivers and replace with a lifetime ban
attributes.background:
Currently the law in the UK states that drink driving offenders MAY GET, 6 months’ imprisonment, 
an unlimited fine, a driving ban for at least 1 year (3 years if convicted twice in 10 years)
attributes.additional_details:
These dangerous people should be taken off the road for good and the penalties for those who offend should be a lot stricter. An example must be made.
Almost 1 in 4 drink driving offenders return to court for the same offence in the UK.

attributes.action: Government to make lie detector tests compulsory for suspects.
attributes.background: The main aim of this petition is to persuade government and parliament to make lie detector tests complusory on suspects also lie detector tests should be carried out without the permission of suspects as a routine check.
attributes.additional_details: Innocent lives are lost and the families want to find out who the suspect may have been. Cases of crime and violence will be easier to resolve and justice will be given to innocent families.

attributes.action: Portable barbecues, not disposed of safely, start wildfires. Restrict their sale
attributes.background: Many wildfires start with a hot disposable barbecue left to smoulder. They should be sold responsibly with clear, robust advice about the risks. And proper advice about the very real risk of wild fires.
attributes.additional_details:
I’ve just seen a serious moorland fire which lasted for several
Days. It was started by a disposable barbecue left in a car park. Supposedly extinguished but resurrected by breezes. Causing risk to local
Property and residents, firefighters, farm animals and wild life

attributes.action: Put the negotiated Brexit deal to the electorate.
attributes.background:
The government has negotiated a bad Brexit deal.
If this deal is the only one available from the EU this and the other options of no deal and remain should be put to the electorate for a mandate. Politicians cannot agree a way forward and no one can honestly say what was voted for in 2016
attributes.additional_details:
Minority government with no mandate for any current option. Historical failure to inform public debate by failure to place relevant data, reports and documents into the public domain in a timely manner. Lack of public trust in motives and actions of many politicians.
Without a mandate any decision - deal, leave with no deal or remain -risks alienation of a large proportion of the electorate and will set back future progress after that decision has been made. 
Democracy requires public engagement

attributes.action: Increase the minimum wage for hgv drivers
attributes.background: I’ve been an hgv driver for 9 years and have been on the same wage with no increase, yet minimum wage keeps getting close to a skilled hgv drivers wage. The average hgv driver age is 56 and the country is short of drivers as it is (60,000)
attributes.additional_details: So in 10 years time the numbers will be far greater, so act now and increase the wage to reflect the work we do on a daily basis and encourage the younger generation to take up a career in driving, because as it stands now I wouldn’t recommend it to

attributes.action: Cap life insurance premiums for applicants with Mental Health problems.
attributes.background: I was medically discharged from the Armed Forces in 2016 and with this dramatic change in my life I suffered with depression and an adjustment disorder, a problem I still suffer with.  After a battle with myself I finally built up the courage to get the help I needed, but It has now taken me 2 years
attributes.additional_details: to find a company that will actually give me life insurance and within this search was point blank refused cover by multiple insurers.   After allowing an insurer to obtain a targeted medical report from my GP they have offered to cover me, but I was shocked that there was around a 200% premium increase compared to that of my wife’s. The added financial burdens will not only deter people from getting help but will also add more pressure to those affected and may hinder recovery.

attributes.action: Introduce impact of humans/plastic on the environment to the primary curriculum.
attributes.background: The effect we as a species have on the environment, especially when discussing plastic, is extremely important and may have considerable consequences on the lives of today's children. Educating them will help them understand how to help and protect the environment and their future.
attributes.additional_details: The response from people of all ages after watching David Attenborough's Blue Planet II was overwhelming - people want to change the way we use plastic. However children of a primary school age do not necessarily have access to the information provided by the series. Educating all children across the country allows them to make their own judgements on what is right or wrong for the future of plastics and inform them for when they're old enough to vote on such matters.

attributes.action: Water safety & effects of cold water to be taught to teenagers
attributes.background: In 2018 we have seen a increase in the amount of deaths in water from cold water shock and drowning, This increase is due to the hot weather we have had. This makes it more worrying that none really trains members of the community or school children on the dangers of open water and how to stay safe.
attributes.additional_details:
We really need to train youngsters and adults in the dangers of cold water shock, this can be triggered by jumping into the water which holds its temperature between 10 degrees - 15 degrees, 

The biggest danger is inhaling water and drowning, even if the water is flat, calm and you know how to swim. Cold Water Shock causes an immediate loss of breathing control. You take one or more huge gasps, followed by hyperventilation – very rapid breathing that is hard or impossible for you to control.

attributes.action: Regulate prescription fees from all UK veterinary surgeons.
attributes.background: Unregulated, vets can now charge what they like for writing prescriptions. A £5.00 standard charge should be made law to enable already over charged clients to purchase medications elsewhere such as a Animal chemist for often up to 800% cheaper than buying from a vet.
attributes.additional_details: Above information is easily checked by anyone having an invoice from their vet for medications and comparing same items on price with various animal chemists that are found on line.

attributes.action: Make online retailers disclose the courier company that they use on website
attributes.background: With a varying degree of service provided by differing courier companies and not knowing which company will be (or not) delivering your goods, it should be compulsory for all online retailers to disclose which company they are using, prior to checkout on the website.
attributes.additional_details: Knowing which courier company has been engaged stops the lottery of will they or won't they deliver. In rural areas we know which companies are reliable and which ones don't bother at all, however, when we order we are then subject to the lottery of will goods turn up or not. This will ensure that we can have an informed choice as to whether to proceed with the purchase or not before committing to it.

attributes.action: Reopen the Exeter to Plymouth Railway line via Okehampton
attributes.background:
Exeter to Plymouth has currently one railway line connecting two big cities. The current railway line in bad weather is always being closed to trains. This cuts off Plymouth and Cornwall from the rest of the country.
Reopening the Okehampton route will help the situation.

attributes.action: Illegal for children under the age of 16 to purchase eggs
attributes.background: Following the recent devastating incidents and criminal damage that has been caused not only in my area but around the country with children throwing eggs at cars, houses and shops has created a big upset.
attributes.additional_details: A young boy has been left critically injured, after a group of children had thrown an egg, from the opposite side of the road, at a cars front windscreen which led the driver to not be able to see where they were going and innocently hitting a young boy, who was trick or treating with his friends, this has left him with a bleed to his brain and not knowing who his mum and other family members were. Just imagine the upset that the family is going through. I pray that Brendan has a speedy recovery

attributes.action: Require fathers who pay child support to be named on the birth certificate.
attributes.background: It seems today we have a very unfair systems in which a resident parent can prevent a non-resident parent from having any rights, prevent visitation and still claim money.
attributes.additional_details:
If a mother knows who the father is, it should be a requirement that they are named on the birth certificate, before any claims for child support can be made. 
Today we talk about how everyone should be treated equally, yet it seems unless you're the father of child out of wedlock. It equality of parents has been forgotten.

attributes.action:
SIGN THE UN TREATY ON THE PROHIBITION
OF NUCLEAR WEAPONS.
attributes.background: In 2017 The UN has approved a Treaty which prohibits nations from developing, testing, manufacturing, transferring, possessing, using or threatening to use nuclear weapons, or allowing these to be stationed on their territory. 122 countries were in favour; 69 did not vote, including the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The Doomsday Clock, published by the distinguished Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists, now stands at 2 minutes to midnight; the closest to total catastrophe since the Cold War. Nuclear weapons are the most destructive, inhumane and indiscriminate weapopns ever created. A single nuclear warhead, could kill millions of people. In the age of cyber warfare, the global 15,000 warheads pose a threat to human survival. The UK must lead the way to a nuclear-free and safer world by joining the UN Treaty.

attributes.action: H M Forces Veterans ID Card
attributes.background: Following many years loyal service in H M Forces, indeed having been willing to give their life for their country, I think it is time H M Government recognised this service for all veterans by establishing an official MoD H M Forces Form 90V ID card for all those who have served.
attributes.additional_details: The ID card should show the service (RAF, Army etc.), the rank on retiring, dates of service, photo, signature and date of birth, to therefore make it a fully recognised VIC (Veterans Identity Card). The card should also include a PIN facility for electronic use.

attributes.action: Should be a pets NHS. Not every1 can afford their pets ops and treatments
attributes.background: If you can't afford your pets operations or treatments they end up getting put down and its not fair. If your from a working class family it can be hard providing for your family as well as paying huge vet bills. Pets are part of the family!:)xxx
attributes.additional_details: please sign

attributes.action: Make it law that cyclists must wear crash helmets
attributes.background: Make it law that all cyclists must wear protective headwear when out on the road.
attributes.additional_details: In 2015 - the last year for which statistics relating to accidents caused by cyclists are available - two pedestrians were killed and 96 seriously injured after being hit by a bicycle. But every year more than 100 cyclists are killed and more than 3,000 seriously injured on British roads – the majority by motorists.

attributes.action: School should start at 10am as teenagers are too tired
attributes.background: Teenagers are so tired due to having to wake up very early to get to school. The Government should require secondary schools to start later, which will lead to increased productivity at school.

attributes.action: Repeal Welfare Reform Act 2012 and ban outright zero hours contracts
attributes.background: The Welfare Reform Act 2012 and zero hours contracts are causing huge levels of social deprivation and poverty impacting significantly on disabled and vulnerable people which must be stopped.

attributes.action: Allow Tattoos for 16 year olds with parental consent
attributes.background: Allow special tattoos for 16 year olds in meanings of birth, death and engagements e.g. 16.04.10 and scan photo or 16.04.10 to 28.02.64 and picture portrait.
attributes.additional_details: Allow memorable tattoos for 16 year olds.

attributes.action: Make selling a new house without building regulation sign-off illegal.
attributes.background: New build houses are being sold without a buildings regulation approval certificate being handed over on completion. Make selling a new build house that has not been signed off by building control illegal and a prosecutable offence.

attributes.action: Tax Break for citizens who are renting and do not own a home
attributes.background: Government should give tax-breaks to those who are renting. Foreign investment in housing has allowed companies to make housing their business by buying/selling & renting out. This causes house prices and rents to continuously soar and has already made homes unaffordable to middle-class citizens.
attributes.additional_details: Whenever new flats are built some percentage of it goes to council. Then a huge percentage are bought by foreign/local companies. Then whatever flats are left, some of them are bought by people who already have homes. This puts a huge pressure on supply and greatly increases the supply-demand gap that triggers house prices shoot up. Home is a basic necessity as food & water, and therefore it cannot be allowed to become a business. If Government is not doing enough, then people should be compensated.

attributes.action: Increase nhs staff awareness and training on the signs and symptoms of sepsis
attributes.background:
I have since heard of many other cases of children with sepsis being misdiagnosed having gastroenteritis, sometimes with long term effects. 
I want government to look at this issue and increase training awareness within the nhs to prevent more unnecessary child deaths or life changing effects.
attributes.additional_details:
Our son, had severe leg pain, a very high temperature, vomiting and neck stiffness. We called 111 who sent us an ambulance to a and e. When we arrived, were seen by the doctor, he took a brief look over our son and asked of his symptoms. We said the symptoms, then he concluded that it could be gastroenteritis. He said we could take him home if he could keep some food down, which he did. However I said I was very concerned as he could not sit up unaided at this point and I would like another opinion. The paedeatrician came and immediately suggested meningitis and sepsis. He took bloods immediately and put our son onto strong antibiotics (this saved his life). The bloods later came back as positive for meningococcal septaceamia. 
Without fast treatment for Sepsis, it can be fatal.

attributes.action: Make laws to prevent the fitting of excessively noisy exhausts to motor bikes
attributes.background: There are an increasing number of motorbikes and cars with exhausts that can be heard through double glazing and from over a quarter of a mile away. They disturb sleep, prevent conversation and cause stress. Their only purpose is to draw attention to the vehicle
attributes.additional_details:
A number of motorbikes and some cars frequently disturb me, often during the night or very early morning. Most people with whom I discuss this have also been disturbed.
One motorcyclist wakes me any time between 5:30 and 6:30am. He starts from his home, which I haven't yet identified, pushing his bike, and starts it up outside my house. He clearly knows it is too loud and avoids disturbing his own family.
The Chief Medical Officer has expressed concern about air and noise pollution.

attributes.action: Redefine the term ‘majority’ in regards to referendums as a minimum of 65%.
attributes.background: 52% is NOT  majority; this means that the will of a significant portion of the population goes unheeded. The government needs to redefine the term 'majority' in a referendum to 65% minimum.
attributes.additional_details:
In other countries, such as the US, a major change to the constitution requires two-thirds majority in both the Senate and House of Representatives. The fact that in the UK a result of just over 50% can constitute a major change can and has led to major social divisions within the country whilst also meaning that the will of a significant portion of the population goes unheeded. This makes the country vulnerable to disinformation.

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36306681

attributes.action: Make it illegal for pedestrians to cross a road where a crossing is visible.
attributes.background: Too many RTA occur on the roads of England, with a majority of these being due to pedestrians crossing a road where a pedestrian crossing is accessible for them to use. Drivers are punished for stupidity of pedestrians! It’s illegal in the USA and I feel it should be here where a crossing is visible

attributes.action: Keep Beechen Cliff as a state school as supported by parents and pupils
attributes.background:
The government are querying whether to close Beechen Cliff school in Bath due to a recent Ofsted report. This report was a shock to pupils, teachers and parents and in no way reflects the school.
Please sign this petition to stop the government withdrawing funding and closing the school

attributes.action: The government should require all rail companies to offer part season tickets.
attributes.background: Rail prices continually increase year on year out of line with wage increases. Those working part time are forced to make a choice between accepting sky high day fares or buying season tickets which do not offer good value for money. Women and carers are disproportionately affected.
